news.title: Thane civic body collects ₹556 crore property tax, cracks down on defaulters
news.para: In 2025-26, Thane Municipal Corporation has reported a collection of Rs 556.19 crore in property tax, falling over Rs 200 crore short of their ambitious Rs 841 crore goal. In response, Municipal Commissioner Saurabh Rao has initiated stringent measures against those who haven’t paid.

news.title: RBI considering allowing banks to lend to REITs
news.para: The Reserve Bank of India is set to introduce a series of groundbreaking regulations. Soon, banks could have the green light to finance Real Estate Investment Trusts, potentially transforming the landscape of property investments. Furthermore, the RBI is planning enhancements for the corporate bond market and outlining new guidelines for foreign exchange transactions.

news.title: Haryana: Landowners to face FIR for leasing, selling farmland for illegal factories
news.para: Haryana pollution control board will now register FIRs against landowners leasing agricultural plots for illegal factories, alongside unit operators. This move aims to break the land supply chain and curb air pollution by holding both parties accountable, marking a shift from previous enforcement strategies.

news.title: RBI pauses rate cuts, retains interest rate at 5.25%
news.para: The RBI has paused its policy rate at 5.25% after a previous 25 basis point cut in December, citing geopolitical uncertainties. This decision follows a period of rate reductions and comes amid historically low retail inflation and robust GDP growth. However, a depreciating rupee raises concerns about potential inflationary pressures.

news.title: YEIDA reclaims 62 acres in Mathura demolition drives
news.para: The Yamuna Authority reclaimed approximately 62 acres of encroached land valued at Rs 1,000 crore in Mathura district, targeting illegal hotels and eateries within Heritage City project limits. This action follows a separate drive that cleared 25 acres worth Rs 400 crore. These efforts aim to combat land mafias active in the region.

news.title: LIC eyes higher yields from real estate
news.para: Addressing a press conference after the board meeting, the corporation’s MD & CEO R Doraiswamy said LIC has decided to go slow on its earlier announced plan of entering the health insurance business, which was announced by his predecessor. For the quarter ended Dec 2025, the corporation reported standalone net profit of Rs 12,958 crore, up 17.2% from Rs 11,056 crore in the corresponding year-ago period.

news.title: Six plots in Ahmedabad worth ₹528 crore cleared for auction
news.para: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's standing committee has approved the auction of six city plots, setting a combined base price of over Rs 528 crore. These include commercial and residential plots in areas like Motera, Chandkheda, Nava Vadaj, and Thaltej, with varying per square meter rates.

news.title: Telangana RERA directs promoters to pay interest to plot buyers for delayed project
news.para: Telangana RERA has ordered Apoorva Infra to compensate buyers of its "Swaminarayana Eco Township" for project delays. The authority mandated refunds with interest for some buyers and interest on delayed payments for others. The developer cited pandemic and legal disputes for the setbacks.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Two developers accused of cheating investors of ₹2 crore
news.para: Developers linked to Privilon Group are accused of cheating investors out of Rs 2.22 crore in housing and commercial projects in Ghuma village. Two FIRs detail allegations of selling properties on land not owned by the developers and without mandatory regulatory approvals, leading to a police investigation.

news.title: Noida authority launches plot schemes, allotment to be via e-auctions
news.para: Noida Authority has launched multiple plot schemes across various categories, including corporate, religious, commercial, hotel, and group housing. Applications are open until February 26, with most allotments conducted via e-auction. The schemes offer plots ranging from small religious sites to large commercial and hotel developments.

news.title: Sebi proposes expanding liquid MF investment scope for REITs, InvITs
news.para: Sebi is proposing significant changes for REITs and InvITs. These include wider investment choices in liquid mutual funds and allowing InvITs to hold special purpose vehicles even after concession agreements end. Sebi also plans to align investment rules for private InvITs with public ones for greenfield projects.

news.title: Merely renting flat doesn't exclude homebuyer from consumer rights: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has underscored that renting a residential flat does not disqualify buyers from being considered consumers. Builders are now obligated to demonstrate that a property was acquired with commercial intentions to negate consumer rights.

news.title: SC rescues homebuyers of Supertech, upholds NCLAT order asking NBCC to take over stalled projects
news.para: The Supreme Court has directed NBCC to swiftly complete 16 Supertech housing projects.  Financial and operational creditors will have their dues addressed after project completion. Tribunals and high courts are restrained from hindering this crucial work.

news.title: Knowledge Realty Trust's net operating income up 19% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Knowledge Realty Trust's net operating income grew 19% year-on-year to ₹10,407 million for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Revenue increased 21% to ₹11,787 million. The company declared distributions of ₹6,953 million.

news.title: Godrej Properties' net profit rises 22.55% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Godrej Properties has announced a significant 22.55 percent rise in its net profit for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company's booking value surged by 55 percent year-on-year, reaching ₹8,421 crore. Collections also saw a strong 40 percent increase.

news.title: Berger Paints' net profit decline 8.32% in Q3 FY26
news.para: In the quarter ending December 31, 2025, Berger Paints India experienced an 8.32% decrease in net profit, totaling ₹271.35 crore compared to ₹295.97 crore in the previous year. Although total income showed a slight uptick, the early part of the quarter was affected by prolonged monsoons and a shorter festive season.

news.title: Oberoi Realty emerges highest bidder for RLDA’s 11-acre land in Bandra East, Mumbai
news.para: Oberoi Realty has emerged as the highest bidder for a prime railway land parcel in Bandra East, Mumbai. The company will lease approximately 11 acres for 99 years, with a bid of ₹5,400 crore. An upfront payment of ₹495 crore is due, with the balance paid over time through revenue sharing.

news.title: Glada razes three illegal colonies in Ludhiana’s Manakwal, Mehmoodpura areas
news.para: Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) demolished three unauthorized colonies in Manakwal and Mehmoodpura, enforcing a zero-tolerance policy against urban sprawl. Developers ignored legal notices, leading to the action. Glada warned the public against investing in such high-risk zones, stating no basic amenities will be provided.

news.title: Pune civic body to attach 58 properties of tax defaulters
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation is aggressively pursuing tax defaulters, targeting 58 properties, mostly commercial, to meet its revenue goals. With ₹5,500 crore outstanding, the PMC is attaching properties and even using music bands to prompt payments. This crackdown comes as citizens question potential property tax hikes, urging focus on recovering existing dues.

news.title: Government marks ₹3,000 crore for townships in Western Uttar Pradesh
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government is allocating nearly Rs 3,000 crore for affordable housing townships in western Uttar Pradesh. These projects will come up in Agra, Mathura-Vrindavan, Moradabad, and Bagpat. The funds will be used for land acquisition and developing modern amenities. Moradabad will receive the largest share for a significant residential layout. Mathura will see two township projects.
